net.i2p.app

Class CorrectedShellService

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.i2p.app.CorrectedShellService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientApp

    public class CorrectedShellService
extends Object
implements ClientApp
    Alternative to ShellCommand based on ProcessBuilder, which manages a process and keeps track of it's state by PID when a plugin cannot be managed otherwise. Eliminates the need for a bespoke shell script to manage application state for forked plugins. Keeps track of the PID of the plugin, reports start/stop status correctly on configplugins. When running a CorrectedShellService from a clients.config file, the user MUST pass -shellservice.name in the args field in clients.config to override the plugin name. The name passed to -shellservice.name should be unique to avoid causing issues. (https://i2pgit.org/i2p-hackers/i2p.i2p/-/merge_requests/39#note_4234) -shellservice.displayName is optional and configures the name of the plugin which is shown on the console. In most cases, the -shellservice.name must be the same as the plugin name in order for the $PLUGIN field in clients.config to match the expected value. If this is not the case, i.e. (-shellservice.name != plugin.name), you must not use $PLUGIN in your clients.config file. The recommended way to use this tool is to manage a single forked app/process, with a single CorrectedShellService, in a single plugin. When you are writing your clients.config file, please take note that $PLUGIN will be derived from the `shellservice.name` field in the config file args. Works on Windows, OSX, and Linux.
    Since:
    1.6.0/0.9.52
    Author:
    eyedeekay

    • Method Detail

      • startup

        public void startup()
             throws Throwable
        Determine if a CorrectedShellService corresponding to the wrapped application has been started yet. If it hasn't, attempt to start the process and notify the router that it has been started.
        Specified by:
        startup in interface ClientApp
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • checkIsStopped

        public boolean checkIsStopped()
        Determine if the PID found in "shellservice"+getName()+".pid" is running or not. Result is the answer to the question "Should I attempt to start the process" so returns false when PID corresponds to a running process and true if it does not. Usage in PluginStarter.isClientThreadRunning requires the !inverse of the result.
        Returns:
        true if the PID is NOT running, false if the PID is running

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(String[] args)
              throws Throwable
        Query the stored PID of the previously launched CorrectedShellService and attempt to send SIGINT on Unix, SIGKILL on Windows in order to stop the wrapped application.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ClientApp
        Parameters:
        args - generally null but could be stopArgs from clients.config
        Throws:
        Throwable

      • getState

        public ClientAppState getState()
        Query the PID of the wrapped application and determine if it is running or not. Convert to corresponding ClientAppState and return the correct value.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface ClientApp
        Returns:
        non-null

      • getName

        public String getName()
        The generic name of the ClientApp, used for registration, e.g. "console". Do not translate. Has a special use in the context of CorrectedShellService, it is used to name the file which contains the PID of the process CorrectedShellService is wrapping.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface ClientApp
        Returns:
        non-null

      • getDisplayName

        public String getDisplayName()
        The display name of the ClientApp, used in user interfaces. The app must translate.
        Specified by:
        getDisplayName in interface ClientApp
        Returns:
        non-null
